data.text: Chased by Dogs on Cycling Tour
Hi I am currently on a European cycling tour now in south of Poland I am chased by dogs Does anyone have a solution?
You mean right now ?? Just go faster !! üòÖ Sorry, just a joke. Don't try to run. Move slowly away. Pick some stones ...
data.author: Hynek Cval√≠n

data.text: I use a boat Klaxton. Works great at scaring the shit out of approaching tire biters.
data.author: Chuck Atkinson

data.text: have you tried the whistle?
data.author: Alain Glantzmann

data.text: Alain, nope! The klaxton really, really gives the dog a "WTF was that?" experience, stopping their charging action.
data.author: Chuck Atkinson

data.text: Get off the bike and speak to them
data.author: Paolo A. Milonakis

data.text: Get off the bike right away and put bike between you and dogs, if they don't back off try yelling and picking stones, dont ride away, WALK away, ...slowly
data.author: Nima Kh-Sh

data.text: thanks what about pepper spray or ultrasound or whistle?
data.author: Alain Glantzmann

data.text: I never deeded one
data.author: Nima Kh-Sh

data.text: yes I have seen this done and agree.
data.author: Triss Pollington

data.text: They can't be that fast if you have time to send a message üòÅ
data.author: Gary Butcher

data.text: I'm picturing him texting with one hand as slavering hounds are nipping at his heels... :)
data.author: Peter Harger

data.text: Treats, throw treats to them, every dog likes treats, I'm surprised you don't have them as a part of your road kit. Have them to hand always.
data.author: Steve Toczyski

data.text: thanks what kind? Meat chocolate?
data.author: Alain Glantzmann

data.text: Dried meat, usual canine treats, anything to distract them whilst you put distance between you and them
data.author: Steve Toczyski

data.text: meat, not chocolate (chocolate is bad for dogs)
data.author: Ken Murphy

data.text: oh so we must treat attacking dogs kindly ‚Ä¶ no chocolate üòâ
data.author: Renata Vallero Winzer

data.text: they‚Äôre just being dogs
data.author: Ken Murphy

data.text: cycling I am more likely to have chocolate at hand than meat !!
data.author: Renata Vallero Winzer

data.text: Get off the bike and pretend to pick up a rock. That will send just about any dog running away. You do not actually need to pick up a rock. Pretending to pick up a rock is usually enough.
data.author: Claus Andersen

data.text: I know that works. Used that in Spain when the guard dogs for the sheep spotted us. They stop immediately when you pretend to pick up a stone.
data.author: Rob Romani

data.text: Poland? Is that a polish sausage in your pocket?!? Those dogs just want some delicious sausage! Dice some up and sprinkle liberally. Or don't and wield it like a blunt weapon!
data.author: Blake Brown

data.text: I learned in Ireland that a dog that's sitting in the road can be bargained with. A dog that's running has already made up it's mind. The water bottle works
data.author: Simon Owens

data.text: What do you do with the water bottle? Squirt it at them?
data.author: Triss Pollington

data.text: squirt. They try and bite the water spray and forget about you!
data.author: Simon Owens

data.text: a dog bit my back wheel in Co Leitrim. It was running with intent and not sitting on the road so your tip is a good one üòÇ.
data.author: Paula O'Connor

data.text: Stop, shout at the dogs, through stones. Don't cycle away. Move in their direction. You have to show them that you are the stronger without fear. At the beginning it is not easy, but after a while you believe it yourself.
data.author: Matthias Alexander

data.text: do the dogs know about this?
data.author: Gus Angelopoulos

data.text: Yes, it‚Äôs called instinct and pecking order.. ‚Äòguard‚Äô dogs are a different thing but dogs in the street are rarely guard dogs..
data.author: Adam Macer

data.text: I stop and get off. They normally retreat or at least stop and keep barking. Then when you get back on they will come at you again. Then I get off and repeat the process üòÇ So far I‚Äôve only had small to medium sized yappy ones. One time in Spain the biggest dog I‚Äôve ever seen in my life went at me but he was chained luckily and almost did a backflip when he ran out of slack. Didn‚Äôt realised he was chained initially though and almost soiled myself üòÇ
data.author: Nelson Incog Nito

data.text: Lots of stray dogs in Romania, so I believe it is a similar situation. Whenever I see dogs showing interest, I stop. It confuses the dogs, because they expect you to run away and them to chase you. I learned this trick simply because my chain fell off while I was approaching a pack of dogs. You should've seen their faces as I was slowly coming to a stop üôÇ However, when dealing with a large pack and they look like they want to eat you alive, back up to a wall, tree, or anything such that they can not encircle you.
data.author: Dani Dobre

data.text: If they arent barking, but are running for you they are likely to try and bite, so either cycle away faster or get off and fight them / scare them / reason with them. If they are barking, they probably won't bite, so just keep going or if they are too annoying, get off the bike, sometimes this puts them at ease.
data.author: Xander Gisbey

data.text: I was terrified of being chased by dogs on our European trip so we carry doggy biscuits to distract them, rape alarm to affect their ears and last resort muscle freeze spray to squirt in their eyes. Only had to use the doggy biscuits so far‚Ä¶ü§ûüèº
data.author: Triss Pollington

data.text: dog biscuits? Sounds like Training the dog(s) to rund after the bicycle‚Ä¶hum‚Ä¶ the biscuit. üòâ
data.author: Georges Froidevaux

data.text: this poor lad is probably feeling the aftermath of your treat motivated harasser dogs
data.author: Cameron Adam

data.text: No fear!, They smell it on you... fear means danger to a dog, so they start coming for you. As long as they bark you should be okay...if a dog is coming for you in silence or gnarling...good luck! Take a steel container, put in some steel ball bearings, shake...(make sure it is loud) see dogs run for their mommy..
data.author: Barry Kwaaitaal

data.text: Cycle fast
data.author: Danny Lancewicz

data.text: You have to be harder than the dog
data.author: GS McFaul

data.text: I've always stopped and yelled at them. Surprisingly, several times in SE Asia packs of dogs came after us and I would sweet talk them and they would immediately stop and walk away.
data.author: Gerry Newton

data.text: Show them your copy of "Canine Etiquette", place book on ground, tell them to turn to page 38 and read the section on Courtesy to Cyclists.
data.author: Bob Marshall

data.text: Hello . There are 3 types of aggression 1) Those who approach you barking are the least dangerous, they see you fleeing and they will run away and bark but they will hardly bite you, in front of them just stop and yell at them and you will see how they go. 2) Those who are afraid will only attack if they feel in danger, it is very dangerous because they take it as life or death. Just walk away slowly, without turning your back on him, without intimidating him. This also applies to dogs that are defending their territory and/or livestock. and 3) Dogs that come running towards you without barking, these are very dangerous and will almost certainly bite you, they do it out of hunting instinct since they see you as fleeing prey. In this case, everything is worth defending yourself. I hope it helps you to be able to act correctly before the cute puppies. (sorry for the bad english, any error was due to the google translator) üòõ
data.author: Facundo Lerra

data.text: For this last case, put your legs to the test and try to beat your speed record hahaha. Also keep in mind that if they are a herd, they hardly cower, they take courage and can be very dangerous. Run forest run!
data.author: Facundo Lerra

data.text: This is excellent advice. Not all dog encounters are equal. Being truly attacked by a dog is very scary and you do not want to get bitten and go through the rabies series... If you can't outrun a dog who is truly coming after you, use any means necessary to defend yourself.
data.author: Brenna Sullivan

data.text: I haven't had any experience with dogs riding bikes, but pepper spray should work. there are some ultrasound devices to keep dogs away, maybe a stick or a stone, maybe a horn like those used in football will work. i'm not sure, in thailand i had problems with dogs while walking at night, they were always big groups, i just screamed to go away and faced the dogs, i was never bitten, but a little scared. Have a good trip and stay strong. I liked the comment that talks about feeding the dog, maybe it works. Good luck
data.author: Rudi Vilson

data.text: If this is Police ( in Poland nickname for police officers is Dogs) you should stop. Otherwise start yelling on theme and ride not stopping, it is not common group of dogs, but do not afraid and ride , they will leave you if you will not provide theme any food.
data.author: Marcin Bogda≈Ç

data.text: Carry a machete
data.author: Eric Robertson

data.text: Pretend to pick up a stone. They tend to run away when people do that. Always keep your bycicle between you and the dogs, use it as a barrier so they can't bite you.
data.author: Nuno David

data.text: Get a high pitched whistle from a diving shop!!! Made me feel so much safer and works!
data.author: Elizabeth Bush

data.text: Shoot them
data.author: Arwel Griffith

data.text: Fireworks
data.author: Pdl Breaking

data.text:
https://amzn.eu/d/9BIcgsT
PetSafe SprayShield Animal Deterrent Spray
amazon.co.uk
data.author: Justin Beamish

data.text: A high pitched whistle
data.author: Anne Winkler-Morey
Dennis Irvine

data.text: I would just try the pies
data.author: Ian Hill

data.text: Ride south east a bit. Dogs would be the last thing to worry about. üò¨
data.author: Ian Hill

data.text: I squirt my water bottle at charging dogs. Startled, they usually stop, while I continuing to pedal away.
data.author: Kent Cowherd

data.text: I have a dog that sometimes chases and barks at bikes. She would never bite them. It will depend on the breed. I have had to outrun many dogs in India. I think these dogs are just wanting you out of their territory and for them its fun to chase a bike. In the past people have talked about a water pistol as being a good deterrent.
data.author: Andrea Collisson

data.text: I usually sprint into them screaming, they get scared and flee..if you stop is better to pretend to grab a stone/stick, and they usually flee
data.author: Tiago Lopes

data.text: face themÔºå stop running awayÔºåpick a stone and throw at them
data.author: Feng Tianshi

data.text: pedal faster
data.author: Jeff Hocker

data.text: shout at him "spierdalaj". should work üòÖüö¥
data.author: Maciek Andrzejczak

data.text: Talk to them ask them what they barki.g at. That often shuts them up. If they continue yell sort and sharp
data.author: John Axson

data.text: Clearly nobody has a definitive answer! There is a guide called '1001 ways to scare off a dog when cycling'. I tried no1 and got bitten, the other 1000 weren't much better üòâ
data.author: Rick Rich Walters

data.text: Stop for a while face and rebuke them and you'll see they won't charge and they'll cancel the chase of you.
data.author: Junskie Canales

data.text: Long wooden stick/pole or a baer spray
data.author: Bostjan Rav

data.text: Small fire extin
data.author: MMarc RRussell

data.text: 99% of dogs chasing bikes are doing it because they love chasing things and barking but are not aggressive. Some feel threatened so avoid direct eye contact as its challenging for dogs. I'd recommend stopping and talking softly to them and try to make friends. Carry some dog biscuits and you will melt their hearts.
data.author: Josh Taylor

data.text: Pistol
data.author: David Scott

data.text: Polish dogs like polish sausage üòú
data.author: David Kfrerer

data.text: steel capped boots. Dogs' skulls are amazingly solid, and dogs will instinctively roll to bleed off speed after being kicked in the head by a cyclist they've chased down traveling at 15 km/h.
data.author: Alex Myers

data.text: Ride faster
data.author: Nick Pontrelli

data.text: Squirt with a waterbottle. Then use a frame mounted pump if that fails. Or ride faster!
data.author: Carl Schefe

data.text: Biscuits , give them some biscuits.
data.author: Dip Mondal

data.text: Yeaah shout like you are about to bite them. It usually works
data.author: Constantin Megalokonomos

data.text: did anyone try ultrasonic dog repeller? Wonder if that really works.
data.author: Modestas Lukauskas

data.text: A small air horn.
data.author: Dave Henry

data.text: Paint balls. Last resort, paint balls with skunk scent.
data.author: Kelly Peck

data.text: Hey
data.author: Omar Oman

data.text: Last time I had one chase me, I sprinted until I could see stars. It worked!
data.author: Matthew Klassen

data.text: a stupid lazy comment if he is in fact on a fully loaded touring bicycle
data.author: Allan David Desmond

data.text: so sorry for wasting the OP's time and your time for having to so politely point out my stupidity and laziness. If indeed he was on a fully loaded touring bike.
data.author: Matthew Klassen

data.text: really its no trouble- if you could take the time an effort to be stupid about a fully loaded touring bicycle trip .. the least the rest of the world could do is acknowledge all your hard work. You‚Äôre welcome.
data.author: Allan David Desmond

data.text: some people don't realize just how much work it takes to be stupid and lazy about fully loaded touring bicycle trips. Much obliged for the recognition. Gobbless.
data.author: Matthew Klassen

data.text: Pedal faster
data.author: Pablo Cortez

data.text: That's why I hate dogs and I absolutely love cats. Fokk dogs. Let's cook them like in Asia. Perfect fry. üòÉüëç
data.author: Dani Daniel

data.text: Pedal faster!!!
data.author: Jerry Creek

data.text: Bear Spray!! Stand Your Ground!!!
data.author: James Gadsden

data.text: Get your drunk ass off the merry-go-round
data.author: Charlie White

data.text: Pedal faster. Sorry couldn't resist
data.author: Paul Turley

data.text: A gun
data.author: Richard Dale England

data.text: If none of the solutions recommended above work, run away as fast as you can to the next village. As the new urbanization approaches, other dogs will likely come to meet you and scare away your pursuers. With these new dogs do the same to the next village... and so on.
data.author: Dominique Wauters

data.text: Bark louder than them
data.author: Bryan Mark Urbsaitis

data.text: Pedal faster
data.author: L√ºca Vasall

data.text: And if you get bitten, find a doctor and start rabies shots!!!
data.author: Kimberly S. Winick

data.text: Stop and face the animal(s). You are threatening them. They should back off. If you deem it necessary place your bicycle between yourself and the offensive animal. They are pack animals alerting there is an intruder. If you keep moving w/o challenging the pack then it becomes a game for them. Water pistol...Pepper spray...dog treats. I do not know what you have access to where you are.
data.author: Louisa Esquivel

data.text: Hi, generally dogs do not cross their territory....just get off your bike...Very simple...
data.author: Bharat Ketkar

data.text: I carry a small white pepper sprinkler tub. Let them get alongside and then shake it in their eyes.
data.author: Mick Nash

data.text: Change country.
data.author: Toon Moons

data.text: I've been attacked by a rothweiler I stood my ground behind the bike until the owner came for his dog...that was 25 years ago... Now I carry a "shocker"
data.author: Jeffrey Segal

data.text: I carry a dog teaser that sends out very high noises
data.author: Emmy Raaff

data.text: Cinnamon and chili pepper in little tin foil packets do the trick
data.author: Todd Smith

data.text: thanks do you put them on your bike?
data.author: Alain Glantzmann

data.text: yrp I make them in little tin foil packs that I can tear open and throw at dogs if they get aggressive most evil only chase though
data.author: Todd Smith

data.text: Carry a monkey fist and a small pepper spray. Normally dog chase you when you look into their eyes. I just ignore them and they leave me alone.
data.author: Bryan Low

data.text: When I had a paper round back in the 70s. My bike pump was a very good deterrent. Especially when applied to the nose of said chasing dogs.
data.author: John Morrissey
